episodes.summary: Jake and Amy attempt to get their parents to bond over Thanksgiving dinner, but their first holiday together as a family does not go well. Meanwhile, at the precinct, Holt and Kevin's special Thanksgiving pie is stolen from his office and Holt searches through the ranks for the possible culprit.

episodes.name: Return to Skyfire
episodes.summary: When Terry's favorite author, DC Parlov, returns to the precinct because his latest manuscript was stolen, Terry and Jake convince Rosa to go undercover with them at a fantasy fiction convention to find the culprit. As drama ensues between Parlov and another writer, Terry admits that he's been writing a book of his own. Back at the precinct, Holt, Amy and Charles take a forensics course, but Charles' big mouth gets him in trouble.

While the entire precinct attends a funeral in LA, Holt learns that he is in the running to become Chief Commissioner of the NYPD - his dream job. But after missing their flight back to New York, Jake must devise a variety of ways to get Holt back in time for the interview. Forced to stay with some estranged members of the Boyle family, Amy tries to convince everyone that she can be laid back, Terry panics about losing his first-class flight and Charles uncovers some new information about Rosa's personal life.

episodes.name: Game Night
episodes.summary: Rosa begs Jake to help her break some big news to her parents, but her plan is thrown off when they wrongly assume the two are dating. Gina returns to help the 99 get their internet access back from the Cyber Crimes division.

episodes.name: The Favor
episodes.summary: When Seamus Murphy returns to redeem the favor Holt owes him, the precinct searches for a loophole that will allow Holt to uphold his end of the bargain without breaking the law.

episodes.name: Safe House
episodes.summary: After Seamus threatens Kevin, Holt devises an elaborate plan to hide him in a safe house, with Jake as his guard. Kevin is miserable as the 99 works overtime to find Seamus and take him down.

episodes.name: The Negotiation
episodes.summary: Jake is called upon to negotiate a hostage situation with a jewel thief, only to discover that the culprit seems to be a familiar face. Amy and Gina help Charles with the high demands of his new food truck, and Holt panics when a member of the Police Commissioner selection committee decides to interview Hitchcock about Holt.

episodes.name: The Box
episodes.summary: Jake embarks on an all-night long interrogation in order to elicit a confession out of a suspect. But when Captain Holt skips the opera in order to stay back and help, the two cops clash over how to get him to talk.

episodes.name: The Puzzle Master
episodes.summary: Jake surprises Amy with an investigation into a string of arsons connected to her favorite crossword puzzle author, Vin Stermley. Meanwhile, Gina helps Holt jazz up his Commissioner candidate speech, and Terry, Rosa, Hitchcock and Scully argue over who is most deserving of the new detective car.

episodes.name: Nutriboom
episodes.summary: Jake and Charles realize that they've been suckered into the cult-like NutriBoom pyramid scheme, and must find a way to sever their contracts.

episodes.name: DFW
episodes.summary: Jake invites his newly discovered half-sister to stay with him in New York, but when he and Amy realize she's a bit of a nightmare, they must find a way to get her back home to Dallas.

episodes.name: Gray Star Mutual
episodes.summary: When a fire destroys Charles' food truck, Pimento unexpectedly shows up to the scene as the insurance agent. Meanwhile, Rosa helps Amy to see that it's okay to get excited about picking her wedding dress, and Gina and Terry coach Holt in the art of social media.

episodes.name: Bachelor/ette Party
episodes.summary: Charles plans an elaborate scavenger hunt for Jake's bachelor party, but the day goes awry when the guys decide to take some shortcuts instead. Meanwhile, Amy's bachelorette party escalates when the ladies realize she previously slept with a member of her soon-to-be wedding band.

episodes.name: Show Me Going
episodes.summary: When Rosa responds to an active shooter alert, the rest of the squad is forced to stay back, desperately fearing for her safety. Feeling helpless, Jake frantically brainstorms ways to offer his assistance, Terry faces an existential crisis and Gina and Amy try to make themselves useful by fixing Rosa's broken toilet.

episodes.name: White Whale
episodes.summary: Rosa and Amy team up to take down their "white whale" suspect - a ruthless killer who has managed to elude them for seven years - while Terry helps Jake tackle his wedding planning chores. Then, Captain Holt and his rival, Olivia Crawford, try to convince each other to step down in the campaign for Commissioner.

episodes.name: Jake & Amy
episodes.summary: Jake and Amy's wedding day is majorly threatened, and Charles and the whole squad rush to help save it. Amidst the chaos, Holt hesitates to open the email that will indicate if he has won his campaign for Commissioner, despite Gina's encouragement. Meanwhile, Terry gently pushes Rosa towards a potential love interest.

episodes.name: Honeymoon
episodes.summary: Jake and Amy go on their honeymoon. Capt. Holt finds out whether he is the new commissioner of the NYPD.

episodes.name: Hitchcock & Scully
episodes.summary: Jake and Charles investigate a case of Hitchcock and Scully from the 1980s. Meanwhile, Amy's uniformed officers and Terry's detectives fight over limited resources.

episodes.name: The Tattler
episodes.summary: Jake and Gina attend their 20th high school reunion. Back at the Nine-Nine, Charles helps Rosa with her love life.

episodes.name: Four Movements
episodes.summary: Gina plays a high-stakes game of chess with Captain Holt. Rosa and Amy take Gina out for a fancy brunch. Jake and Gina must use their wits to infiltrate a posh club.

episodes.name: A Tale of Two Bandits
episodes.summary: Terry believes the Pontiac Bandit is stealing cars again, but Jake is convinced his friend wouldn't do that. The rest of the squad fight to keep Shaw's a police bar after some firemen stake their claim to it.

episodes.name: The Crime Scene
episodes.summary: Jake and Rosa must deal with a mother in mourning as they work and rework a crime scene in order to solve a difficult murder case with confusing evidence.

episodes.name: The Honeypot
episodes.summary: Jake and Holt clash over the merits of a new hire in the 99th precinct. Terry, Amy, Rosa and Charles try to do something about the cluttered bullpen.

episodes.name: He Said, She Said
episodes.summary: Jake and Amy investigate a difficult "he said, she said" case. Holt becomes suspicious after learning his lifelong arch nemesis died in a prison transport accident.

episodes.name: The Golden Child
episodes.summary: Jake helps Amy navigate the complicated relationship she has with her brother, David. Charles introduces some drama into an undercover mission involving Terry and Holt.

episodes.name: Gintars
episodes.summary: A visitor from Latvia causes Charles and Jake to investigate Nikolaj's family. Holt and Amy bring in famed forensic scientist Dr. Yee to help close a case for Rosa.

episodes.name: The Therapist
episodes.summary: Charles brings Jake into a case when a therapist reports one of his patient's missing. Holt finds out Rosa has a new girlfriend that everyone else has met. Amy believes she has accidentally received a package meant for Terry.

episodes.name: Casecation
episodes.summary: Work is so busy for Jake and Amy that they end up celebrating their anniversary while standing guard over a comatose patient in the hospital.

episodes.name: The Bimbo
episodes.summary: Holt and Jake investigate a case at Kevin's university. Back at the precinct, Terry and Amy take the squad out for lunch.

episodes.name: Ticking Clocks
episodes.summary: In an episode that takes place in real time, Jake and the squad must track down a hacker who has infiltrated the Nine-Nine's servers. Rosa deals with relationship issues. Hitchcock and Scully attempt to cook the perfect lasagna.

episodes.name: Return of the King
episodes.summary: When Gina returns to the Nine-Nine, Jake and Terry get drawn into her life. Holt learns that Charles's son, Nikolaj, may be a genius. Rosa copes with an injury.

episodes.name: Cinco de Mayo
episodes.summary: In order to distract Terry from the stress of his upcoming lieutenant's exam, Jake, Holt and the squad decide to hold the annual Halloween Heist on a new date, Cinco de Mayo.

episodes.name: Sicko
episodes.summary: Jake and Charles investigate a dangerous serial killer. Holt continues to spar with his rival, Commissioner Kelly. Terry finds out about whether or not he has passed the lieutenant's exam.

episodes.name: Suicide Squad
episodes.summary: Desperate circumstances call for desperate measures, as Jake, Holt, Amy, Terry, Rosa and Charles must ally themselves with old enemies

episodes.name: Manhunter
episodes.summary: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt on a city councilor. Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer.

episodes.name: Captain Kim
episodes.summary: A new captain at the Nine-Nine attempts to ingratiate herself with Jake and the squad by inviting them over to her house for a dinner party.

episodes.name: Pimemento
episodes.summary: Adrian Pimento shows up unexpectedly to seek Jake and Charles' help after claiming someone is trying to kill him. The rest of the squad endures a Workplace Conflict seminar.

episodes.name: The Jimmy Jab Games II
episodes.summary: Competitive juices are flowing as Jake and the squad compete in the second Jimmy Jab Games.

episodes.name: Debbie
episodes.summary: When cocaine and weapons are stolen from the evidence lock-up, the squad must investigate the Nine-Nine itself.

episodes.name: Trying
episodes.summary: Jake and Amy work an uncrackable case while Holt adjusts to a new beat. Hitchcock looks for the love of his life.

episodes.name: Ding Dong
episodes.summary: Captain Holt deals with a personal loss. Jake must decide whether to take Terry or Charles to an exclusive event.

episodes.name: The Takeback
episodes.summary: Doug Judy is back and this time things between him and Jake are personal. Amy and Charles try to find the perfect new vending machine for the Nine-Nine.

episodes.name: Dillman
episodes.summary: When a prank goes disastrously awry, things at the Nine-Nine take a distinctly Agatha Christie turn.

episodes.name: Admiral Peralta
episodes.summary: Jake and his father deal with unsettled family business. Amy and Rosa work a high-profile case. Terry wants to join the NYPD band.

episodes.name: Valloweaster
episodes.summary: The squad competes in an effort to determine who is the greatest human/genius.

episodes.name: Ransom
episodes.summary: Holt asks for Jake's help in a case that is exceptionally meaningful to him. Charles and Terry work together on a side business.

episodes.name: Lights Out
episodes.summary: The entire squad is on high alert when a massive blackout hits Brooklyn.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: Cheryl can't leave Ruby alone on her first week at kindergarten. Jim says it's because she's a woman and decides to take her himself, but he also can't leave her behind.

episodes.name: No Nookie
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl find their romantic getaway to the Bahamas set to work out perfectly, with Dana babysitting the kids. However, at the last minute, Dana is not able to babysit. In the meantime, Andy becomes a little too obsessed with making the perfect tree house for Grace and Ruby.

episodes.name: The Cat Came Back
episodes.summary: Cheryl's 15 year-old cat Mr. Feeney dies and she wants Jim to bury it on the backyard, but Jim wants to go to the Bears game with Dana and Andy. He sticks the cat in the garage freezer, planning on burying it after the game, but Cheryl finds out before he comes home.

episodes.name: Anniversary
episodes.summary: On Jim and Cheryl's 10th Anniversary, Jim pays Dana to buy him an anniversary gift to give to Cheryl. Dana buys a beautiful and touching charm bracelet and Cheryl finds out that Dana bought the bracelet when Jim can't tell her the meaning of the charms that are on the bracelet. She also finds out that all her anniversary gifts over the past ten years were bought by Dana.

episodes.name: Unruly Spirits
episodes.summary: On Halloween, Cheryl has forbidden Gracie to go trick-or-treating. However, not wanting his daughter to miss out on the fun of the halloween spirit, Jim sneaks her out anyway. Andy becomes convinced that he's being stalked by an ex-girlfriend.

episodes.name: The Crush
episodes.summary: Cheryl finds herself falling for a guy that Jim has setup for Dana.

episodes.name: Cheryl's Old Flame
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl find themselves wondering if they've set too many rules for their household when they find themselves arguing over whether to put a TV in the girls' room, making Jim promise Cheryl not to ride his motorcycle, and Ruby then tells Jim that Cheryl has been smoking again.

episodes.name: The Turkey Bowl
episodes.summary: Cheryl is left alone to cook Thanksgiving dinner while Jim and Andy go bowling for a charity event. Worse, Jim invited friends to Thanksgiving dinner without telling Cheryl and while Jim is still bowling.

episodes.name: Andy's Girlfriend
episodes.summary: Andy starts dating Ruby's piano teacher. When the two couples get together for dinner, Jim finds out the piano teacher is a vegetarian, a feminist, and a Packards fan. These are three hot buttons for Jim.

episodes.name: An According to Jiminy Christmas
episodes.summary: Cheryl's mother is coming to visit them for Christmas and wants to stay at their house. Jim and Cheryl, however, prefer that she stayed at a hotel but don't know how to bring it up without insulting Maggie.

episodes.name: Bad Word
episodes.summary: Cheryl leaves Jim in charge of their kids and some other kids who were there to play with the girls during a Bears game. The next day, one of the kids mom calls Cheryl saying her daughter dame home repeating a swearing she heard from Jim.

episodes.name: Model Behavior
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl agree to let Ruby model for a print ad as a one-time thing, but when the photographer calls her a natural, Jim gets Ruby an agent.

episodes.name: The Money
episodes.summary: Cheryl decides to go behind Jim's back and loan Andy $1,000 for a downpayment on a new condo but finds the money is missing.

episodes.name: Blow-Up
episodes.summary: Cheryl does something uncharacteristic for her - she gives Jim a sexy portrait of herself for Valentine's Day. When she finds out Jim shares the picture with all his friends, she is mortified.

episodes.name: Racquetball
episodes.summary: Cheryl returns home from the gym, and tells Jim she had a great time playing racquetball. She asks Jim to play racquetball with her but he declines. She tells him he is just afraid he will lose, and then the game becomes a challenge.

episodes.name: Under Pressure
episodes.summary: Jim gets hurt after jumping on a pogo stick and goes to the doctor. There, he finds out he has high blood pressure and has to start taking pills everyday. Cheryl tries to reduce the stress for Jim.

episodes.name: Date Night
episodes.summary: Andy helps Dana with taxes. Dana watches Jim & Cheryl's children while they go on a date. Jim finds a parking place, but before he can park, someone else takes it. Jim is angry and keeps talking about the spot while they eat dinner.

episodes.name: Birthday Boys
episodes.summary: Andy & Kyle share the same birthday. Dana gives Kyle a large custom painted mural for his bedroom, and plans to pay for everyone's dinner out. She comments she makes more money than Jim. Now Jim has to prove he can buy everything too.

episodes.name: The Receipt
episodes.summary: Jim wants to exchange a broken DVD player within the warranty period but cannot find the receipt. He blames Cheryl for losing it, but she says it is not her responsibility to keep track of all his items.

episodes.name: Old Friends
episodes.summary: Jim runs into Danny, a friend he has not seen in years. Danny is still single and accuses Jim of being a settled married man. Jim sets out to prove Danny wrong by both of them partying at bars all night like they used to do.

episodes.name: Cheryl's Day Off
episodes.summary: Cheryl has a day of errands and time with her friends. Jim has to watch the children, but when he has a chance to have the kids go to friend's home, he readily drops the kids off. When Cheryl returns, he forgets where the kids are at.

episodes.name: No Surprises
episodes.summary: Cheryl plans a surprise party for Jim but he'd rather go bowling.

episodes.name: The Importance of Being Jim
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl clash over a digital camera. He deletes a picture she wanted to keep, so she hides the camera from him.

episodes.name: Cars & Chicks
episodes.summary: Dana needs to buy a new car and Cheryl offers to go with her, but Jim says chicks are no good buying cars by themselves, because they'll get distracted with other less important things like mirrors or cup holders. Offended, Cheryl is determined to prove Jim wrong and actually gets Dana a car for a fair deal, but the car soon breaks down.

episodes.name: The Baby Monitor
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl meet the new neighbors and find out that they can hear their conversation through the baby monitor. When the neighbors find out, Jim tries to come up with a story to smooth things over.

episodes.name: The Pizza Boy
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl have a new house guest when the pizza delivery boy moves in with them. Ronnie wants to do stand up comedy, but his father tells him he will never make money that way. Ronnie decides to move out of his father's house.

episodes.name: The Closet
episodes.summary: Jim wants his own space in the house for his own things and for a place where he can be alone. Cheryl starts to thin out her closet, but Dana convinces her to get more items.

episodes.name: Punch and Ruby
episodes.summary: Jim takes the girls to their first baseball game, and Cheryl tells him to be on his best behavior and set a good example. At the game, Jim gets into a shouting match with another fan, and their argument ends up on the show broadcast.

episodes.name: The Bachelor
episodes.summary: Dana gets accepted to be on the reality show The Bachelor. Jim gives her advice on how to keep a man interested. When Dana and the bachelor visits Jim and Cheryl for dinner, the bachelor reveals to Jim he only wants to get Dana in bed.

episodes.name: Father Disfigure
episodes.summary: The family goes to church, and Jim realizes he knows the new minister. When Jim was young, he and the reverend played dodge ball together.

episodes.name: Thanksgiving Confidential
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Jim are organizing the school's Thanksgiving Day play, and when they are alone on the set, they decide to get intimate. Andy and the PTA President walk in on them, and the story gets spread. Cheryl is dismissed from the play.

episodes.name: The Christmas Party
episodes.summary: Cheryl is hoping to have the family invited to a neighbor's popular annual Christmas party, but Jim dashes her hope when he fights with the neighbor's husband.

episodes.name: The Brother-in-Law
episodes.summary: Jim is excited when Dana's new boyfriend asks him to play backup music at a bar. The offer does not include the other members of Jim's band, and Jim tries to do it without Andy finding out.

episodes.name: Moral Dilemma
episodes.summary: When Jim reviews the credit card statement, he finds the bank made an error and now has surplus money. Jim takes Cheryl out to an expensive dinner with the money.

episodes.name: You Gotta Love Somebody: Part 1
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl's friend Danny visits. He brings his police officer partner with him. Cheryl realizes that Laraine likes Danny and hopes he will ask her to the policeman's ball.

episodes.name: You Gotta Love Somebody: Part 2
episodes.summary: Jim & Cheryl's friend Danny, and Andy, retell the story how they helped Jim and Cheryl get together.

episodes.name: The Smell of Success
episodes.summary: Jim has another quick-rich scheme, and much to Cheryl's dismay, Jim, Andy and Dana think it is a good idea. Jim's idea is to make a doll who has gas movements.

episodes.name: Slumber Party
episodes.summary: Cheryl has to do everything to prepare for Ruby's birthday party since Jim seems to mess things up. On the day of the party, Jim ends up having to deal with all the little girls for the sleep over party.

episodes.name: The Ring
episodes.summary: When an old girlfriend of Jim's comes to dinner, she accidentally reveals things to Cheryl that Jim wanted kept secret about them.

episodes.name: Wonder Woman
episodes.summary: Cheryl becomes a Wonder Woman when she pursues a man who tries to steal her purse. Jim finds out about the attack on Cheryl and goes overboard in trying to protect the family by getting killer dogs.

episodes.name: The Pass
episodes.summary: Cheryl is upset when one of Jim's new clients makes a pass at her and Jim does nothing about it.

episodes.name: Dana Gets Fired
episodes.summary: Jim talks to Dana's boss about his treatment of employees. Dana ends up getting fired.

episodes.name: Bo Diddley
episodes.summary: Cheryl needs a root canal, but she does not want to have it done. Jim says he will go with Cheryl so she will have support. However, at the dentist office, Jim realizes that Bo Diddley is in the building and he wants to leave Cheryl.

episodes.name: Deal with the Devlins
episodes.summary: Cherly's new friend is another soccer mom who Jim finds annoying. Cheryl enjoys her company, so the two families become social friends. Eventually, Jim tells Cheryl she has to break off the friendship.

episodes.name: The Helmet
episodes.summary: Cheryl finds the perfect gift for Jim's birthday on an online website and starts to bid on it. Another person is also bidding for the same perfect gift - Jim.

episodes.name: No Harm, No Foul
episodes.summary: An exotic bird flies into Jim's back yard, and Gracie decides to keep it as a pet. The bird is loud and annoying, but Gracie refuses to let her parents get rid of it.

episodes.name: About a Girl
episodes.summary: Dana takes Ruby to the park, and a single father strikes up a conversation with her. When Dana realizes he thinks she is the mother of Ruby, she decides to keep up the charade. Cheryl asks Jim to exercise more.

episodes.name: Mom's Boyfriend
episodes.summary: Cheryl's mother comes to visit, and tells everyone she is engaged. Cheryl and Dana are not happy about it, but Jim and Andy find the guy to be fun. Jim and Andy take Frank to a strip joint, and he dies from the excitement.

episodes.name: Vegas, Baby: Part 1
episodes.summary: When Jim & Andy go to Las Vegas on a business trip, Cheryl & Dana also go for a vacation. Cheryl secretly hopes to reunite Jim and his sister Roxanne. Roxanne typically uses people. When Jim and Roxanne make up, she says she needs money.

episodes.name: Vegas, Baby: Part 2
episodes.summary: After Jim makes up with Roxanne, she asks for money. Since Jim is hesitant, Roxanne settles on Dana and they get married. Now that Roxanne has money, she starts seeing her old boyfriend again. Also, their meeting in Vegas turns out bad.

episodes.name: The Errand
episodes.summary: Jim is outraged to learn they pay for groceries to be delivered. Cheryl says they have deliveries for a lot of things. He says he will take over the job of grocery shopping and other errands himself to save money, but it does not work out.

episodes.name: The Packer Ball
episodes.summary: Kyle has a new favorite toy - a Packers Team football. Since Jim's favorite team is the Chicago Bears, he does not like that Kyle has a different team's ball.

episodes.name: We Have a Bingo
episodes.summary: Jim wins a water-bed when playing bingo at a church fund-raiser. The pastor realizes Jim cheated, and talks to him about doing the right thing.

episodes.name: Getting to Know You
episodes.summary: Jim gets Cheryl a pair of expensive pair of earrings that is similar to the pair of earrings she usually wears. Cheryl accuses Jim of not knowing her. To get back in her good graces, Jim tries to notice everything and buys more gifts.

episodes.name: The Lemonade Stand
episodes.summary: The girls get permission to open a lemonade stand to earn money. When the neighbors start a better lemonade stand in competition, Jim, Cheryl and the others up the competition.

episodes.name: ABC's and 123's
episodes.summary: Jim tells Cheryl she is making a big deal of Ruby doing homework. Cheryl tells him that he should try it. Since Jim does not want to, he talks to Ruby's teacher to give less homework because Cheryl cannot read. His story gets back to Cheryl.

episodes.name: Dana Dates Jim
episodes.summary: Dana's new date is similar to Jim in many ways. Cheryl teaches Dana that she is basically dating Jim, and when Dana realizes it is right, she gets upset at Cheryl for pointing out the similarities. Cheryl hosts a Halloween party.

episodes.name: Scary Movie
episodes.summary: Jim takes the girls to see a scary movie even though Cheryl tells him not to. When the girls have nightmares at bedtime, Cheryl thinks she did something wrong.

episodes.name: Imaginary Friend
episodes.summary: Jim seems to always be busy helping a friend when he and Cheryl are to visit with some friends. Cheryl realizes this happens only when it is a specific couple.

episodes.name: Paintball
episodes.summary: Jim is tired of Cheryl always picking activities for them as a couple, especially the cooking class which was a disaster. He picks paint-ball for the next activity, thinking she will hate it.

episodes.name: The Empty Gesture
episodes.summary: Cheryl climbs the roof to get the tablecloth Jim tied there for a Halloween. When she is stuck on the roof and no one notices she is missing, she realizes she is taken for granted. Jim says he will make Thanksgiving dinner but then doesn't.

episodes.name: Rules of Engagement
episodes.summary: Jim is puzzled when Cheryl apologizes to him in the morning, but he accepts the apology and decides to use it against her to get out of everything he does not want to do.

episodes.name: Secret Santa
episodes.summary: Dana does not have money to buy Jim a Christmas gift, so Cheryl tells her to just take one Cheryl already purchased and say it is from her. Dana ends up putting her name on the most expensive gift and claims it as hers to give.

episodes.name: House for Sale
episodes.summary: The house across the street from Jim & Cheryl is on sale. The Devlins visit and announce they are placing a bid on the house. Jim & Cheryl are upset and thinking of moving to get away from them.

episodes.name: Dana Dates the Reverend
episodes.summary: Dana is fed up because she attracts only shallow men. Jim is in trouble because his bowling team is missing one player. It just happens that Reverend Pierson is the solution to both problems. Unfortunately, there is a catch.

episodes.name: The Best Man
episodes.summary: Danny and Laraine announce their intent to marry, and Danny asks Jim to be his best man. Cheryl tells Jim he better not get Danny drunk at a bachelor party. So instead, Jim takes him for a cold swim in Lake Michigan and gets him sick.

episodes.name: Cheryl Sings
episodes.summary: Cheryl decides to sing in Jim's band to prove to her cousin that she has talent. Trouble is, Cheryl cannot sing.

episodes.name: When You Wish to Be a Star: Part 1
episodes.summary: At Dana's new job, she gets to cast a family for a vacation commercial. She hires Cheryl and her family. The producer likes everyone except for Jim.

episodes.name: When You Wish to Be a Star: Part 2
episodes.summary: Jim is troubled because his replacement in the commercial, Ted, gets to be a bit too intimate with Cheryl in front of camera. So when a role opens, he grabs it. Mysteriously, Kitson turns gay when Andy is in the table.

episodes.name: No Crime, But Punishment
episodes.summary: Gracie has been acting up lately, and Jim says that Cheryl's gentle ways are not working for improvement. Jim comes up with a harsh punishment plan but takes it too far when he blames her for something she did not do.

episodes.name: The Baby
episodes.summary: Jim's sister Roxanne visits Cheryl and Jim. She tells them she is going to have a baby, and Andy is the father.

episodes.name: Who's the Boss?
episodes.summary: Jim is working hard to please his new client, Veronica, which actually means that he's making Andy work hard. Because the boss can't be seen working hard publicly. But then Andy and Veronica have a talk.

episodes.name: The Truck
episodes.summary: The girls made a large paper mâché bear for the school for team spirit. Jim has to take the bear to school in his truck, but he lost his truck in an arm wrestling match and does not want to tell Cheryl.

episodes.name: The Toilet
episodes.summary: Cheryl promises to take Jim's opinions seriously when she decides to remodel the bathroom, until Jim insists it include a hideous high-tech stainless steel toilet – that talks.

episodes.name: Trashed
episodes.summary: Pack rat Cheryl asks Jim to rent a storage unit to house seven years' worth of the kids' art projects, but Jim refuses to pay the fee, so he tosses everything out, thinking Cheryl won't notice – until she needs some of the projects for a special retirement party for Ruby's art teacher.

episodes.name: The Marriage Bank
episodes.summary: Thinking it might get Cheryl to let him go on a fishing trip with Andy, Jim makes a "deposit" in the "marriage bank" by agreeing to go to a couples seminar with her. Jim's plans are foiled, however, when Dr. Ted, the marriage guru, declares the whole marriage bank mentality unhealthy and Cheryl learns Jim's real motives – so that Dr. Ted must intervene.

episodes.name: Everyone Gets Dumped
episodes.summary: Jim develops a friendship with Dana's new boyfriend, despite the fact that the guy dumped Cheryl years ago.

episodes.name: The Swimming Pool
episodes.summary: Cheryl protests when a heat wave sends the family sneaking into a vacationing neighbor's pool -- until she starts sneaking over on her own.

episodes.name: A Vast Difference
episodes.summary: Jim chickens out of having a vasectomy, but Cheryl is so effusive in her praise that he's unable to admit he didn't go through with it.

episodes.name: A Hole in One
episodes.summary: Cheryl wants Jim to give up his vices so he can get her pregnant.

episodes.name: The Effort
episodes.summary: Cheryl surprises Jim with a romantic evening, but it cuts into his planned TV boxing match.

episodes.name: The Grill
episodes.summary: Jim offers to give Andy an old barbecue grill, then decides Andy should pay for it.

episodes.name: The Garage Door
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Dana are forced to smash their way out of a locked garage, because they ignored Jim's lesson on how to open the door from the inside.

episodes.name: Dress to Kill Me
episodes.summary: Kyle wants to be Cinderella for Halloween. Jim is against it because he thinks he's growing up to be a sissy. Jim buys Kyle a manly costume (a dinosaur) but Kyle changes back into the dress. Jim, Andy, and Kyle all sit on the couch, Jim and Kyle persistent. Jim goes in the kitchen, sees an older Kyle who convinces Jim to let Kyle go as Cinderella. In the end, they all go as ladies and they trick-or-treat.

episodes.name: Father-Daughter Dance
episodes.summary: Ruby hurts Jim's feelings when she invites Andy to a father-daughter dance instead of him.

episodes.name: Plot Twist
episodes.summary: Cheryl's mother, Maggie, wants Jim, Cheryl and the family to rest someday in a family plot she reserved years ago, but Jim insists on his own family plot--then secretly reserves a a plot for himself next to a star football player.

episodes.name: The Hunters
episodes.summary: To prove his worth as a man, Jim -- along with Andy -- hunt a turkey for Thanksgiving, but on the hunt Jim is pursued -- and shot -- by a legendary 40- lb. psychotic bird christened "Angry Pete."

episodes.name: Poking the Bear
episodes.summary: Cheryl's gynecologist forbids her from having sex with Jim until the time is right to get pregnant, and Jim eats crow in order to win a huge account from a blowhard potential client.

episodes.name: Stalking Santa
episodes.summary: Jim tangles with a department store Santa after the two are involved in a parking lot fender bender. Unfortunately, Jim's kids witness the skirmish and are fearful Santa won't leave them any gifts for Christmas.

episodes.name: Sympathy from the Devlins
episodes.summary: Jim befriends his obnoxious neighbors when he believes they bring good luck when he's watching the Chicago Bulls.

episodes.name: The Nanny-Cam
episodes.summary: Jim buys a nanny-cam to spy on the sitter he didn't want Cheryl to hire but learns something about Cheryl instead, prompting her to buy a camera of her own.

episodes.name: The Jealous Husband
episodes.summary: To make Cheryl feel desirable, Jim fakes a jealous rage in a restaurant and tries to teach Dana's date to do the same, but the lesson backfires when Dana fears her new beau is paranoid and possessive.

episodes.name: A Crying Shame
episodes.summary: Cheryl claims to like men who aren't afraid to cry, but when Jim bursts into tears after a movie, she is surprised to find herself turned off by his sensitivity.

episodes.name: Guess Who's Cooking Your Dinner?
episodes.summary: Cheryl cooks dinner for Dana and her boyfriend and lets him believe that Dana actually did the cooking.

episodes.name: The Wedding Dress
episodes.summary: When Cheryl offers Dana the use of her wedding gown, Jim and Andy try to cover up the fact that the dress was destroyed in a fiery sports celebration years ago.

episodes.name: The Mustache
episodes.summary: A hot delivery girl gives Jim some fashion advice, prompting him to grow a mustache, which Cheryl hates. Cheryl retaliates by becoming a brunette - but Jim loves it. After a chance meeting with the girl, Cheryl asks her to give Jim suggestions that will make him look ridiculous.

episodes.name: Shall We Dance?
episodes.summary: When Andy decides to learn how to dance for his sister's wedding, he turns to Jim, a closet dancer, for help.

episodes.name: Take My Wife, Please
episodes.summary: In order to avoid going to an opera with Cheryl, Jim asks an elderly widower to be her escort.

episodes.name: Spelling Bee
episodes.summary: Jim's pride in Gracie's new-found spelling-bee aptitude quickly turns to dismay when he has to drive her to tournaments all over the state.

episodes.name: Kentucky Fried Beltzman
episodes.summary: Jim is shocked to learn that his recently deceased friend will be buried with a rare baseball card he stole from Jim.

episodes.name: The Clock
episodes.summary: Jim and Cheryl adjust the clocks to get the kids to bed earlier so they can have more quality time together.

episodes.name: The Competition
episodes.summary: Jim, certain he will win the annual hot dog eating contest, is humiliated when instead he loses to a petit woman, and his problems are further compounded when Andy decides to date the female champion.

episodes.name: The Bachelorette Party
episodes.summary: When Cheryl's prim and proper bachelorette party disappoints Dana, Jim and Andy treat Dana to a rowdy night she'll never forget - but now will she make it to the wedding?

episodes.name: Geronimo Jim
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Dana think they have cause to worry when Dana's fiance - wants to race fast cars and Jim wants to take up skydiving.

episodes.name: The Scrapbook
episodes.summary: Jim actually remembers his and Cheryl's anniversary - but Cheryl didn't! Improvising, she gives him the photo album that covers years worth of memories. They start reminiscing.

episodes.name: Wedding Bell Blues
episodes.summary: On Dana's wedding day, Jim accidentally knocks the family's favorite reverend unconscious with the car door, so he has to scramble to find a replacement preacher at the last minute.

episodes.name: Foul Ball
episodes.summary: The fifth season premieres with Jim sneaking off to a Cubs game with Kyle instead of taking him to his first day of kindergarten.

episodes.name: The Tale of the Tape: Part 1
episodes.summary: Jim worries that Cheryl's romantic expectations will increase when his new brother-in-law, Ryan, showers Dana with flowers and gifts. But then Jim learns that a special blues tape Cheryl supposedly made for him when they were dating, and that made him fall in love with her, was actually made for her by an old boyfriend

episodes.name: The Tale of the Tape: Part 2
episodes.summary: Jim worries that Cheryl's romantic expectations will increase when his new brother-in-law, Ryan, showers Dana with flowers and gifts. But then Jim learns that a special blues tape Cheryl supposedly made for him when they were dating, and that made him fall in love with her, was actually made for her by an old boyfriend.

episodes.name: Charity Begins at Hef's
episodes.summary: When Cheryl wins two tickets to visit Hugh Hefner at the Playboy Mansion in a charity-raising contest that Jim secretly entered her in, she decides to take Dana instead of him.

episodes.name: The Race
episodes.summary: Out-of-shape Jim enters a 10K marathon to teach Kyle, who wants to quit basketball, a lesson about not being a quitter -- but he cheats to get first to the finish line.

episodes.name: Anec-Don'ts
episodes.summary: Cheryl, upset that Jim thinks her daily anecdotes are boring, steals Dana's story about meeting Oprah. Jim, now determined to out-do Cheryl, makes up a story about his construction office catching fire. But when Cheryl take the kids to see the damage, Jim and Andy, who are scrambling to make it look authentic, end up setting a real fire.

episodes.name: The Chick Whisperer
episodes.summary: Jim helps Andy pick up a beautiful woman in a bar, but she turns out to be crazy -- and eventually leaves Andy and stalks Jim instead.

episodes.name: James & the Annoying Peach
episodes.summary: To teach Jim the value of communication, Cheryl doesn't speak to him for three days.

episodes.name: The Dream
episodes.summary: Jim tries to blackmail Dana when he finds out she's having erotic dreams about him.

episodes.name: Lean on Me
episodes.summary: Cheryl encourages Jim to meet a former girlfriend wants to discuss business for lunch, and then regrets it when she becomes convinced that the old flame has romantic intentions.

episodes.name: The Gift of Maggie
episodes.summary: When Cheryl and Dana's mother, Maggie, visits for the holidays, Jim and Cheryl compete with Ryan and Dana for her affection

episodes.name: Sex Ed Fred
episodes.summary: When Jim and Cheryl watch an sex education video that is shown at Ruby's school, Jim realizes that he is watching a young him.

episodes.name: Renewing Vows
episodes.summary: Ruby and Gracie want to get their ears pierced but Cheryl believes that this will lead to the girls growing up too quickly and convinces Jim. Jim and Cheryl renew their wedding vows and Jim walks down the aisle with an earring.

episodes.name: The Stick
episodes.summary: It's Jim's birthday and he gets upset when Cheryl gives him gifts he does not want, but is really happy when Kyle give him a stick for his birthday.

episodes.name: Mr. Right
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Jim get into a disagreement about Erik Estrada, and Jim tries to prove that the incident that occurred ten years ago was not wrong.

episodes.name: Get Your Freak On
episodes.summary: Cheryl believes she's attending a tasteful lingerie party, but is shocked to learn the hostess is selling sex toys and Cheryl buys one, but won't tell Jim.

episodes.name: The Grumpy Guy
episodes.summary: Jim gets mad when he finds out that his neighbor Julie has been writing children books and basing them about him.

episodes.name: Polite Jim
episodes.summary: Jim makes his own neighbour cry with complaining about his backyard barbeque, so he ends up taking polite lessons from Andy, in order to become a better person.

episodes.name: Daddy Dearest
episodes.summary: Jim believes that Bill, the father of one of Rubys and Gracies classmates is actually his real father that abandoned Jim when he was a child.

episodes.name: The Thin Green Line
episodes.summary: Cheryl gives her best to assure herself a spot on the Church Committee, and in order to get that, she forbids Jim to do his annual "Green Man" routine on St. Patrick's day. However, her plans are ruined when she gets arrested.

episodes.name: Jim's Best Friend
episodes.summary: When Andy stars playing chess with Ryan on a regular basis, Jim is convinced that he is losing his best friend.

episodes.name: Belaboring the Point
episodes.summary: When a proud and happy Ryan announces that Dana is pregnant, Jim warns him of Dana's upcoming hormone swings, and ends up dreaming that he is pregnant.

episodes.name: The Punch
episodes.summary: Jim realizes that Cheryl has been spoiling their son Kyle for way too long, so he decides to make him a man by teaching him how to throw a perfect punch in self defense. However, things get out of control when little Kyle gets suspended for repeatedly hitting the school bully.

episodes.name: The Flannelsexual
episodes.summary: Jim ends up on a talk show after claiming that men shouldn't let women feminize them, and then goes to Dana's co-ed baby shower to prove his point.

episodes.name: Guinea Pygmalion
episodes.summary: When the family pet guinea pig swallows an eraser, Jim is forced to pay for an expensive operation.

episodes.name: Hoosier Daddy
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Jim go to a motel in Indiana to celebrate their fifteenth wedding anniversary, but Dana's possible labor and a tornado interfere.

episodes.name: Good Grief
episodes.summary: When Cheryl's beloved Uncle Donald dies, Jim takes over housekeeping, but soon starts to suspect that Cheryl is using him.

episodes.name: All the Rage
episodes.summary: Cheryl persuades Jim to attend an anger-management class, but he soon learns that getting mad isn't as much fun as getting even.

episodes.name: Cheryl Gone Wild
episodes.summary: Andy, Ryan and Jim are stunned when they find out that Dana and Cheryl recently appeared in a Chicks Gone Wild video.

episodes.name: Deliverance
episodes.summary: When Dana gets into premature labor, and Ryan isn't able to come and deliver the baby because he is delivering a celebrity's baby, Jim has to be the one to deliver Dana's baby.

episodes.name: Dino-Mite
episodes.summary: When Cheryl and Dana allow Jim and Ryan to take care of the kids and baby Tanner while they are out, things get out of control. Jim takes everyone to the museum and everything goes great until the Tyrannosaurus Rex display ends up destroyed.

episodes.name: Separate Ways
episodes.summary: While Ryan is away, Dana and baby Tanner are staying at Jim and Cheryl's, until Jim starts complaining about the presence of the baby, so Cheryl wants him to stay at Andy's for a while. While Jim and Andy enjoy their male bonding, Cheryl and Dana are enjoying their time together too. At least, until Ryan returns.

episodes.name: In Case of Jimergency
episodes.summary: After an argument with a claims representative about his bill, Jim's health insurance is canceled, and Jim decides to hide the truth from Cheryl, until she ends up sick and he gets her cold.

episodes.name: Coach Jim
episodes.summary: Jim decides to toughen up his daughters basketball team and soon turns them from sweet and peaceful to an angry and aggressive basketball team.

episodes.name: The At-Bat
episodes.summary: Jim's bad softball game advice to Kyle turns to be Jim's worst nightmare when an Ghost of Andy visits him to show him the Adult Kyle's life as a loser.

episodes.name: What Lies Beneath
episodes.summary: Andy's new metal detector uncovers Jim's long-lost wedding ring, which causes headaches to Jim, because he bought a fake wedding ring as a replacement a long time ago so Cheryl wouldn't notice he lost it.

episodes.name: The Grill II
episodes.summary: Andy and Jim end up in a war after Andy tries to sell him a grill that Jim gave him a few years ago.

episodes.name: Devlin in Disguise
episodes.summary: After Tim and Cindy Devlin's sudden divorce announcement, Andy starts spending time with Cindy, which turns into a relationship, and an urge for Cheryl and Jim to break them up.

episodes.name: Any Man of Mine
episodes.summary: In order to avoid attending another musical with Cheryl, Jim finds a gay man to accompany her.

episodes.name: Jim's Birthday
episodes.summary: Cheryl throws Jim an unwanted surprise party for his 50th birthday, which Jim then sabotages, and then later reveals the real reason why he won't celebrate his birthday.

episodes.name: Jim Almighty
episodes.summary: Crazed about the fact that Cheryl joined a dinner party club, Jim insults the very creator of women, God, who then gives Jim the power to try to do a better job, but Jim ends up making women behave like Jim would. Also, when Andy tries to make guys more like women, he turns himself and Jim into oversensitive girly guys.

episodes.name: The Hot Wife
episodes.summary: Cheryl feels down when she can't use her sexuality to get a dinner table at a restaurant, so Jim tries to cheer her up by writing letter as a 'water delivery guy', but his plan soon makes Jim doubt if Cheryl is attracted to him or the delivery guy.

episodes.name: Safety Last
episodes.summary: When Cheryl takes a greater interest in general safety and health, Jim feels stifled by her new rules and regulations. Just after Cheryl forces Jim to wear an I.D. badge during his morning jog, Jim is head-butted by a bull on a side road. While Cheryl learns that one can't anticipate every danger out there, Jim realizes that he's willing to do whatever it takes to make his family feel secure.

episodes.name: The Perfect Fight
episodes.summary: Cheryl and Jim have an evening at home without the kids and decide to stay in and just have dessert for dinner. But Jim's choice of pastries causes a spat which morphs into an all-out food fight. The next day they laugh off the night's argument; Jim is thrilled that they don't seem to have to talk things out. But then Andy, who's out for revenge on Jim for coaxing his kids to play pranks on him, counsels Cheryl to really dissect and analyze her marital arguments.

episodes.name: Cheryl Goes to Florida
episodes.summary: While Cheryl is out of town to take care of her mother, Jim has to take care of their kids, and he receives sympathy from a neighborhood mom. Soon, other moms start helping Jim, and he tells each one that she's the only help in the house.

episodes.name: Ruby's First Date
episodes.summary: While Cheryl is still out of town, Jim is having hard time dealing with Ruby's girl problems, so he assigns Dana to help her. However, when Dana tells Ruby to go out on a date with an older guy, Jim if forced to intervene, as he, Dana and Andy end up following Ruby to her date.

episodes.name: Period Peace
episodes.summary: When Ruby and Gracie can't seem to stop fighting, Jim is "forced" to read their diaries to determine the cause, only to realize that he needs to give out delicate motherly advice to them, while Cheryl is still away.

episodes.name: The Rendezvous
episodes.summary: When Cheryl returns home for a visit the kids end up occupying her time, so Jim decides to prepare a special date with her at the airport lounge, only to end up mistakenly arrested.

episodes.name: Goodwill Hunting
episodes.summary: Without consulting with Cheryl, Jim transforms the garage into a cigar lounge and donates the kids' old clothes and furniture to charity. When Cheryl informs Jim that she is pregnant with twins, he is forced to retrieve all the stuff that he gave away, and has to deal with the fact that he is going to be a father of five.

episodes.name: All Dolled Up
episodes.summary: Jim is forced organize a doll-themed party for Gracie while Cheryl is on bed rest, but when Gracie admits that the only reason she agreed to the party was because she wanted to please her mother, Jim decides to turn the party into something totally else.

episodes.name: Pregnancy Brain
episodes.summary: Jim finds a way to use Cheryl's forgetfulness (a.k.a. "the pregnancy brain") to his advantage by trying to convince her that it was her idea to turn the basement into a media room instead of a room for Ruby and Gracie.

episodes.name: The Gift Certificate
episodes.summary: Realizing that Andy didn't use the gift certificate that Jim gave him for his birthday, Jim decides to use the certificate to treat himself with a nice meal, but soon Jim finds himself in an uncomfortable situation when Andy remembers the certificate and decides to invite Jim to join him for a meal.

episodes.name: I Drink Your Milkshake
episodes.summary: Jim makes a rule he believes to be the perfect cure for children's fights, but when he enters a discussion with Andy, the both end up on the same "tribunal system," fighting to prove who's right.

episodes.name: The Chaperone
episodes.summary: Andy finally meets the perfect girl, but things get rough when he lets Jim babysit the woman's daughters, who then end up missing while Andy is having dinner with Emily.

episodes.name: The Six-Week Curse
episodes.summary: Dana puts Andy under hypnosis to learn why all of his relationships don't last longer than six weeks. Upon learning that it's due to Andy's low self-esteem, Dana decides to boost up Andy's confidence, but she ends up making things worse when Andy starts flirting with other women while on a date with Emily.

episodes.name: The Cheater
episodes.summary: Cheryl insists on playing a game that she somehow always wins, but Dana is aware of the fact that Cheryl is cheating.

episodes.name: No Bedrest for the Wicked
episodes.summary: Jim anxiously awaits for the moment when Cheryl is off bedrest so she'd take over all the chores, but Dana urges him to let Cheryl rest until she goes into labor. After meeting Cheryl's gynecologist, Jim learns that Cheryl was already allowed to be more active, but she didn't tell him.

episodes.name: The Devil Went Down to Oak Park
episodes.summary: The Devil himself visits Jim to remind him of the deal they made years ago, when Jim promised to give away his fifth child if the Devil helped him win over Cheryl.

episodes.name: The Blankie
episodes.summary: Jim guilts the older kids into doing household chores after Jonathan's special blanket goes missing.

episodes.name: The New Best Friend
episodes.summary: When Dana, Cheryl's sister and best friend, moves away, Jim realizes he must find Cheryl a new friend as soon as possible.

episodes.name: Jami McFame
episodes.summary: Jim and his band win a chance to play for a child pop sensation Jami McFame, but when the star gives them an attitude, Jim decides to set her straight.

episodes.name: Andy's Proposal
episodes.summary: Jim urges Andy to propose to Emily or risk losing her, but when he sees Emily dining with another man, he doubts the wisdom of his advice.

episodes.name: Two for the Money
episodes.summary: When Cheryl learns of Jim's plan to use their twins in a movie starring Steve Guttenberg to get some money for Christmas gifts, she refuses to let him do it, but Andy and Jim decide to go through with the plan anyway, only to have it backfire when the producers cut the kids hair to make them look alike.

episodes.name: Cabin Boys
episodes.summary: Jim looks forward to a "guys only" weekend with Andy, but when Andy ends up dumped by Emily over a text message and when the guys stumble upon Emily's depressed ex husband, Jim decides to do his best to cheer up the guys and save what's left of their weekend.

episodes.name: The Ego Boost
episodes.summary: Jim is convinced that an old flame wants to get back with him until he realizes that she wants to hook up with Andy, leaving Jim with a bruised ego.

episodes.name: The Yoga Bear
episodes.summary: Jim becomes intrigued by Cheryl's raving about a yoga teacher so he decides to try out the class, only to end up impressed by the teacher. Both Jim and Cheryl end up taking separate private classes to relax from their busy family life.

episodes.name: Kyle's Crush
episodes.summary: im prepares Kyle for his first "date" with Ruby's slightly older piano teacher, Mandy, whom Andy has fallen for and is secretly dating behind Kyle's back.

episodes.name: The Meaningful Gift
episodes.summary: Andy, desperate to impress Mandy with the perfect birthday gift, turns to Jim for advice. Jim counsels against givivng fancy jewelry, urging Andy instead to give a sentimental gift to win her over. But Andy's recollection of what has meaning to Mandy is way off base, and instead of being pleased with the gift, she thinks he's cheating on her.

episodes.name: The Daddy Way
episodes.summary: Cheryl and her friends, eager to get an afternoon away from the kids, arrange a "Daddy and Me" group for Jim and other dads with young kids at their home. Jim makes the best of a potentially boring situation by turning babysitting into a sporting event--staging baby races where the dads bet on their kids and drink beer.

episodes.name: Physical Therapy
episodes.summary: Andy ends up injured after playing snow football with Jim, so Jim helps Andy make it seem like he had a freak accident because Andy was previously warned by his girlfriend not to play the game.

episodes.name: The Cooler One
episodes.summary: Jim attempts to look cool in the eyes of Ruby and her friends, until he realizes that he may be undermining Cheryl's authority due to his behavior.

episodes.name: Happy Jim
episodes.summary: Jim's bad back has him on prescription pain pills which has him in an altered state and opens up an opportunity for the family to share information which usually would upset him.

episodes.name: King of the Nerds
episodes.summary: Jim uses his passion for sports to connect with son Kyle. But sports-challenged Kyle identifies more with fellow sci-fi nerd Andy, forcing a reluctant Jim to dress up as a Cyclops at a sci-fi convention in order to win his son back.

episodes.name: I Hate the High Road
episodes.summary: Cheryl forces Jim to donate time to charity. His reluctance turns to elation when he's rewarded with a thousand-dollar check for his efforts. Cheryl insists he return the check, but Jim is itching to buy himself somthing frivolous with the money. And to really test Cheryl's integrity, he spends the money on a pricey designer handbag for her.

episodes.name: Diamonds Are a Ghoul's Best Friend
episodes.summary: It's Cheryl's birthday and Jim decides to buy her a diamond necklace. But in an attempt to save money, he buys the necklace from Andy's unreliable source and soon learns that it was taken off of a dead woman whose ghost now begins to haunt him.

episodes.name: Heaven Opposed to Hell
episodes.summary: When Jim chokes on a shrimp puff, he dies and arrives at Heaven's gate. With Jim on trial to prove his selfless acts on earth, best friend Andy is summoned to heaven to defend him. As Jim attempts to prove his good works to God, his sister-in-law, Dana, represents the Devil, arguing that Jim's selfishness should mean a certain trip to hell.

episodes.name: Space Pilot 3000
episodes.summary: A delivery boy frozen in the year 1999 awakens in the year 3000. Phillip J. Fry delivers a pizza to a Cryogenics lab on New Years eve, only to discover that it is a prank delivery and then accidentally falls into a open cryogenics chamber, is put to sleep and wakes up in the far future.

episodes.name: The Series Has Landed
episodes.summary: The crew takes a mission to an amusement park on the moon.

episodes.name: I, Roommate
episodes.summary: Bender offers to let Fry move in with him when Fry is forced to move out of the Planet Express because of his slob style of living.

episodes.name: Love's Labors Lost in Space
episodes.summary: The crew encounters infamous space captain Zapp Brannigan.

episodes.name: Fear of a Bot Planet
episodes.summary: The crew makes a delivery to a planet of human-hating robots.

episodes.name: A Fishful of Dollars
episodes.summary: Fry becomes a billionaire and buys the world's last can of anchovies.

episodes.name: My Three Suns
episodes.summary: Fry accidentally swallows another planet's emperor and gains his title.

episodes.name: A Big Piece of Garbage
episodes.summary: A giant garbage ball from space threatens to destroy New New York.

episodes.name: Hell Is Other Robots
episodes.summary: Bender is sent to Robot Hell for all of his sins. Title tagline "Condemned By The Space Pope".

episodes.name: A Flight to Remember
episodes.summary: The crew takes a vacation on the maiden voyage of the spaceship Titanic.

episodes.name: Mars University
episodes.summary: The Professor introduces the crew to his newest experiment at Mars University.

episodes.name: When Aliens Attack
episodes.summary: Aliens invade Earth in search of a TV star from 1999. Title sequence tagline "Proudly Made On Earth".

episodes.name: Fry & the Slurm Factory
episodes.summary: Fry wins a trip to the Slurm Factory and discovers the secret behind the addictive soda. Title sequence tagline "Live from Omicron Persei 8".

episodes.name: I Second That Emotion
episodes.summary: Leela, Fry and Bender search the mutant-filled sewers for Nibbler. Title sequence tagline "Made From Meat By-Products".

episodes.name: Brannigan Begin Again
episodes.summary: Stripped of his title, space captain Zapp Brannigan begs for a job at Planet Express.

episodes.name: A Head in the Polls
episodes.summary: When the value of titanium skyrockets, Bender sells his body for a large sum of money.

episodes.name: Xmas Story
episodes.summary: An evil robotic Santa Claus attack shows Fry how Christmas has changed in the last 1,000 years. Title tagline 'Based on a true story'.

episodes.name: Why Must I Be a Crustacean in Love
episodes.summary: Zoidberg gets caught up in his species' mating frenzy. Title tagline 'From the network that brought you 'The Simpsons''

episodes.name: Put Your Head on My Shoulder
episodes.summary: Fry's head is conjoined with Amy's body after a car crash. Meanwhile, Bender receives a robot recall and faces the risk of catastrophic butt failure. Title sequence tagline ' Not based on the novel by James Fenimore Cooper'.

episodes.name: Lesser of Two Evils
episodes.summary: Fry suspects Bender's robotic duplicate has stolen a valuable item from the Miss Universe pageant.

episodes.name: Raging Bender
episodes.summary: Bender inadvertently beats up the Ultimate Robot Fighting champion. Leela reminisces about when she wanted to become a fighting champion.

episodes.name: A Bicyclops Built for Two
episodes.summary: Leela meets a man named Alkazar and finds out she is not the only Cyclops. He takes her to his planet and proposes marriage to her, however Fry is suspicious of his motives. Title sequence tagline 'This episode has been modified to fit your primitive screen'.

episodes.name: How Hermes Requisitioned His Groove Back
episodes.summary: Hermes is forced to take a vacation while a female bureaucrat replaces him. Title sequence tagline 'As foretold by Nostradamus'.

episodes.name: A Clone of My Own
episodes.summary: Professor Farnsworth names his teenage clone to be the successor of his research. Title sequence tagline 'Coming soon to an illegal Dvd'.

episodes.name: The Deep South
episodes.summary: The crew discovers the lost city of Atlanta, where Fry falls in love with a mermaid. Title sequence tagline 'A stern warning of things to come'.

episodes.name: Bender Gets Made
episodes.summary: Bender impresses the robot mafia with his thievery and joins them as a hired goon. Title sequence tagline 'Simulcast on crazy people's fillings'.

episodes.name: The Problem with Popplers
episodes.summary: Aliens threaten to devour mankind after the crew unknowingly sells their young as fast food.

episodes.name: Mother's Day
episodes.summary: Mom's broken heart leads her to organize a robot rebellion.

episodes.name: Anthology of Interest (1)
episodes.summary: The Professor creates a What-If machine that answers every question.

episodes.name: The Honking
episodes.summary: The Professor creates a What-If machine that answers every question.

episodes.name: War Is the H-Word
episodes.summary: When Bender and Fry volunteer for military duty, Leela also joins the all-male ranks, as Lee Lemon.

episodes.name: The Cryonic Woman
episodes.summary: Fry is reunited with his girlfriend from the 20th century.

episodes.name: Parasites Lost
episodes.summary: The crew takes a trip inside Fry's body to save him from parasitic worms.

episodes.name: Amazon Women in the Mood
episodes.summary: The crew gets stranded on a planet of Amazonian women.

episodes.name: Bendless Love
episodes.summary: Bender gets jealous when he thinks his new fembot love might still love her ex.

episodes.name: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid
episodes.summary: Only Fry's superior inferior brain can save the day when knowledge-sucking alien brains invade.

episodes.name: That's Lobstertainment!
episodes.summary: Dr. Zoidberg heads to Hollywood to help his washed-up uncle revive his film career.

episodes.name: The Birdbot of Ice-Catraz
episodes.summary: Leela fights to save the penguins of Pluto after an oil spill.

episodes.name: Luck of the Fryrish
episodes.summary: Fry travels to Old New York to retrieve his lucky clover.

episodes.name: The Cyber House Rules
episodes.summary: A trip to the orphanarium leads Leela to get cosmetic surgery and Bender to adopt 12 orphans.

episodes.name: Insane in the Mainframe
episodes.summary: Fry thinks he's a robot after being brainwashed at an insane robot asylum.

episodes.name: Bendin' in the Wind
episodes.summary: A paralyzed Bender joins rock star Beck on the concert road.

episodes.name: Time Keeps on Slipping
episodes.summary: The crew is responsible for a rift in the time/space continuum.

episodes.name: I Dated a Robot
episodes.summary: Fry falls in love with a Lucy Liu robot.

episodes.name: Roswell That Ends Well
episodes.summary: Fry must make sure his grandfather survives in Roswell, NM, or he himself will cease to exist.

episodes.name: A Tale of Two Santas
episodes.summary: Bender takes over as Santa Claus to bring back Xmas spirit.

episodes.name: Anthology of Interest (2)
episodes.summary: The What-If machine projects a human Bender, the world as a video game and Leela in her real home. Title sequence tagline 'Hey TiVo! Suggest this!'.

episodes.name: Love and Rocket
episodes.summary: Bender and the Planet Express ship fall in love resulting in a mishap adventure when Bender jilts her. Title sequence tagline 'When you see the robot, drink!'.

episodes.name: Leela's Homeworld
episodes.summary: Leela learns the truth about her parents and her identity when Bender angers a group of people with his toxic waste dumping. Title sequence tagline 'It's llike "Hee Haw" with lasers'.

episodes.name: Where the Buggalo Roam
episodes.summary: Kif does everything possible to win Amy's parents' approval.

episodes.name: A Pharaoh to Remember
episodes.summary: Bender becomes a tyrannical leader of a planet that resembles ancient Egypt. Title sequence tagline 'Psst...Big party at your house after the show'.

episodes.name: Godfellas
episodes.summary: Bender gets lost in space and becomes a god to a race of tiny aliens. Title sequence tagline 'Please turn off all cell phones and tricorders!'.

episodes.name: Futurestock
episodes.summary: A 1980s businessman takes over Planet Express and threatens to sell it to a larger corporation. Title sequence tagline 'Love it or shove it!'.

episodes.name: A Leela of Her Own
episodes.summary: Leela becomes the first -- and worst -- female blernsball player. Title sequence tagline 'Scratch here to reveal prize'.

episodes.name: 30% Iron Chef
episodes.summary: Bender challenges a famous chef to a cooking contest. Title sequence tagline 'If accidentally watched induce vomiting'.'.

episodes.name: Where No Fan Has Gone Before
episodes.summary: The Planet Express crew is pitted against the cast of "Star Trek" in a battle to the death.

episodes.name: Crimes of the Hot
episodes.summary: Earth's robots are sentenced to death when they are identified as the cause of global warming.

episodes.name: Jurassic Bark
episodes.summary: Fry finds his fossilized dog in a museum exhibit and attempts to bring it back to life with cloning.

episodes.name: The Route of All Evil
episodes.summary: Cubert and Dwight's new delivery company drives Planet Express out of business.

episodes.name: A Taste of Freedom
episodes.summary: Zoidberg is sentenced to death for eating Earth's flag on Freedom Day.

episodes.name: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
episodes.summary: Amy's romance with Kif takes an unexpected twist when he becomes pregnant.

episodes.name: Less Than Hero
episodes.summary: Fry and Leela form a superhero team after a miracle cream gives them super powers.

episodes.name: Teenage Mutant Leela's Hurdles
episodes.summary: The Planet Express crew revert into teenagers after falling into aging tar.

episodes.name: The Why of Fry
episodes.summary: Nibbler recruits Fry on a mission to save Earth from evil, all-knowing brains.

episodes.name: The Sting
episodes.summary: A killer bee sting traps Leela in a strange loop of guilt-ridden dreams.

episodes.name: The Farnsworth Parabox
episodes.summary: The crew ventures into a parallel universe accidentally created by the Professor.

episodes.name: Three Hundred Big Boys
episodes.summary: A $300 tax rebate from the government prompts everyone to live out their aspirations.

episodes.name: Spanish Fry
episodes.summary: Fry goes in search of his nose after poachers sell it on the black market as an aphrodisiac.

episodes.name: Bend Her
episodes.summary: Bender becomes an Olympic fembot and wins the love of a famous robot.

episodes.name: Obsoletely Fabulous
episodes.summary: Bender needs an upgrade when a new robot makes him feel obsolete.

episodes.name: Bender Should Not Be Allowed on Television
episodes.summary: Bender becomes the new star of a soap opera and a bad role model for children everywhere. Title sequence tagline 'Controlling you through a chip in your butt since 1999'.

episodes.name: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
episodes.summary: Fry makes a deal with the Robot Devil in order to master the holophone and show his love for Leela.

episodes.name: Rebirth
episodes.summary: After a devastating crash, the Professor attempts to resuscitate the crew with his birth machine.

episodes.name: In-A-Gadda-Da-Leela
episodes.summary: Leela and Zapp Brannigan find themselves stranded on an Eden-like planet.

episodes.name: Attack of the Killer App
episodes.summary: Fry posts an embarrassing video of Leela online.

episodes.name: Proposition Infinity
episodes.summary: Bender leads a campaign to legalize robosexual marriage between humans and robots.

episodes.name: The Duh-Vinci Code
episodes.summary: The crew races to future Rome to unearth the shocking secret of Leonardo da Vinci.

episodes.name: Lethal Inspection
episodes.summary: Bender learns that he suffers from a mortal manufacturing defect.

episodes.name: The Late Philip J. Fry
episodes.summary: The Professor's one-way time machine takes the crew further into the future, with no hope of return.

episodes.name: That Darn Katz!
episodes.summary: Earth is invaded by a race of intelligent cats.

episodes.name: A Clockwork Origin
episodes.summary: The theory of evolution is put to the test on a planet inhabited by robots.

episodes.name: The Prisoner of Benda
episodes.summary: A revolutionary invention allows the crew members to exchange minds.

episodes.name: Lrrreconcilable Ndndifferences
episodes.summary: After a bungled Earth invasion, alien leader Lrrr faces a midlife crisis.

episodes.name: The Mutants Are Revolting
episodes.summary: Leela leads an army of underground mutants in a rebellion against the surface people.

episodes.name: The Futurama Holiday Spectacular
episodes.summary: The Planet Express crew learns the true meaning of Xmas, Robanukah and Kwanzaa.

episodes.name: Neutopia
episodes.summary: The crew members encounter a bizarre alien with the power to change their sexual characteristics.

episodes.name: Benderama
episodes.summary: Bender gains the ability to self-replicate, threatening to overrun Earth with vast swarms of himself.

episodes.name: Ghost in the Machines
episodes.summary: When Bender dies, his disembodied software haunts the Planet Express building.

episodes.name: Law and Oracle
episodes.summary: Fry quits his job and becomes a police officer assigned to the Future Crimes Division.

episodes.name: The Silence of the Clamps
episodes.summary: After testifying against the Robot Mafia, Bender goes into hiding in the witness relocation program.

episodes.name: Yo Leela Leela
episodes.summary: Leela becomes a Hollywood big shot after creating a hit children's television series.

episodes.name: All the Presidents' Heads
episodes.summary: The crew members alter history when they travel back in time to the American Revolution.

episodes.name: Möbius Dick
episodes.summary: Leela becomes obsessed with hunting down a mysterious four-dimensional space whale.

episodes.name: Fry am the Egg Man
episodes.summary: Fry nurtures an alien egg that hatches into a horrific monster. Title sequence tagline 'If accidentally watched, induce vomiting'.

episodes.name: The Tip of the Zoidberg
episodes.summary: The crew uncovers a covert mission undertaken by the Professor and Dr. Zoidberg many years ago.

episodes.name: Cold Warriors
episodes.summary: Fry's sneezing reintroduces the common cold to the world of the future.

episodes.name: Overclockwise
episodes.summary: Bender evolves into a godlike being after vastly increasing his processing power. Meanwhile, Fry also worries about his relationship and future with Leela.

episodes.name: Reincarnation
episodes.summary: The gang turns into 8-bit, anime and classic black-and-white versions of itself.

episodes.name: The Bots and the Bees
episodes.summary: Bender fathers a child with the office soda machine

episodes.name: A Farewell to Arms
episodes.summary: An ancient prophecy predicts the world will end in the year 3012. Title tagline 'Ask your doctor if Futurama is right for you.'.

episodes.name: Decision 3012
episodes.summary: Leela becomes campaign manager for a presidential candidate with a missing birth certificate.

episodes.name: The Thief of Baghead
episodes.summary: Bender joins the paparazzi and attempts to photograph a famous actor whose face has never been seen.

episodes.name: Zapp Dingbat
episodes.summary: Leela is horrified when her mother begins dating Zapp Brannigan.

episodes.name: The Butterjunk Effect
episodes.summary: Amy and Leela join the Butterfly Derby and become addicted to the nutritional supplement Nectar.

episodes.name: The Six Million Dollar Mon
episodes.summary: Fed up with his inferiority to machines, Hermes replaces his body parts with mechanical upgrades.

episodes.name: Fun on a Bun
episodes.summary: Fry is the victim of a horrific sausage-making accident.

episodes.name: Free Will Hunting
episodes.summary: Bender embarks on a quest for the meaning of life after discovering that robots lack free will.

episodes.name: Near-Death Wish
episodes.summary: His parents' return from virtual retirement aboard the Near-Death Star disturbs the Professor.

episodes.name: Viva Mars Vegas
episodes.summary: The crew stages a casino heist to recover stolen property from the Robot Mafia.

episodes.name: 31st Century Fox
episodes.summary: After saving a robotic fox from hunters, Bender becomes the hunted.

episodes.name: Naturama
episodes.summary: A nature documentary series focuses on groups of animals that strongly resemble the crew.

episodes.name: 2-D Blacktop
episodes.summary: Professor Farnsworth joins a gang of street-racing punks.

episodes.name: Fry and Leela's Big Fling
episodes.summary: Fry and Leela's romantic vacation goes disturbingly wrong. Title sequence tagline 'Watch it or die trying'.

episodes.name: T.: The Terrestrial
episodes.summary: After being marooned on a distant planet, Fry befriends a young monster.

episodes.name: Forty Percent Leadbelly
episodes.summary: At a maximum security prison, Bender meets a famous folk singer and attempts to make a copy of his precious guitar.

episodes.name: The Inhuman Torch
episodes.summary: Bender becomes a famous firefighter, but the crew suspects him of arson.

episodes.name: Saturday Morning Fun Pit
episodes.summary: The Futurama gang stars in a trio of craptastic morning cartoons.

episodes.name: Calculon 2.0
episodes.summary: Bender goes grave robbing to bring his favorite actor back to life.

episodes.name: Assie Come Home
episodes.summary: Bender searches the universe for his missing shiny, metal rear end.

episodes.name: Leela and the Genestalk
episodes.summary: A rare condition causes Leela to grow tentacles and she discovers a secret genetic engineering facility because of it.

episodes.name: Game of Tones
episodes.summary: A strange alien melody is threatening to destroy the Earth and the meaning of it is hidden in Fry's dreams.

episodes.name: Murder on the Planet Express
episodes.summary: The crew becomes trapped aboard ship with a horrific alien creature.

episodes.name: Stench and Stenchibility
episodes.summary: Dr. Zoidberg meets the love of his life while Bender squares off in a deadly tap-dancing competition.

episodes.name: Meanwhile
episodes.summary: Fry enters an infinite loop when he proposes to Leela using a time travel button.
